intro: Mespilodaphne novogranatensis, commonly known as the Colombian persimmon, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red fruits that are edible when fully mature. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical ecosystems and traditional medicine.
